item.title: Scientific Computing, Applied, and Industrial Mathematics (SCAIM) Seminar Series
item.description:
The Scientific Computing, Applied and Industrial Mathematics (SCAIM) Seminar is an interdepartmental seminar at the University of British Columbia (UBC) focused on research in scientific computing, industrial and applied mathematics, mathematical modelling, and computational science.

The audience for the talks are typically faculty members and graduate students from the departments of Computer Science, Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, and Physics & Astronomy. The speakers are researchers from UBC or other institutions.

The seminar was held every 2 weeks.

Role:

  • Co-organizer
  • Facilitator

Period:

  • September 1st, 2014 to June 30th, 2016
  • Organized 34 seminars

Seminars:

  • SCAIM Seminars Series 2014-2015
  • SCAIM Seminars Series 2015-2016
